alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central El Paso County; Northern Hudspeth Highlands, Hueco Mountains; Salt Basin (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 03 at 3:52PM CDT until April 04 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. For the High Wind Warning, west winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico and southwest Texas. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to midnight MDT tonight. For the High Wind Warning, from midnight tonight to 9 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest winds will be along east slopes of area mountains. Blowing dust will be likely each afternoon, with visibilities possibly dropping to less than a mile in isolated locations.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Eastern, Central El Paso County; Northern Hudspeth Highlands, Hueco Mountains; Salt Basin
